metadata.title: CVE-2016-1902 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The nextBytes function in the SecureRandom class in Symfony before 2.3.37,2.6.x before 2.6.13, and 2.7.x before 2.7.9 does not properly generaterandom numbers when used with PHP 5.x without the paragonie/random_compatlibrary and the openssl_random_pseudo_bytes function fails, which makes iteasier for attackers to defeat cryptographic protection mechanisms viaunspecified vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1902` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

php-symfony-asset - 2.7.9+dfsg-1
php-symfony-browser-kit - 2.7.9+dfsg-1
php-symfony-class-loader - 2.7.9+dfsg-1
php-symfony-config - 2.7.9+dfsg-1
php-symfony-console - 2.7.9+dfsg-1
php-symfony-css-selector - 2.7.9+dfsg-1
php-symfony-debug - 2.7.9+dfsg-1
php-symfony-debug-bundle - 2.7.9+dfsg-1
php-symfony-dependency-injection - 2.7.9+dfsg-1
php-symfony-dom-crawler - 2.7.9+dfsg-1

php-symfony-intl - 2.7.9+dfsg-1
php-symfony-locale - 2.7.9+dfsg-1
php-symfony-monolog-bridge - 2.7.9+dfsg-1
php-symfony-options-resolver - 2.7.9+dfsg-1
php-symfony-phpunit-bridge - 2.7.9+dfsg-1

php-symfony-proxy-manager-bridge - 2.7.9+dfsg-1

php-symfony-security - 2.7.9+dfsg-1
php-symfony-security-bundle - 2.7.9+dfsg-1
php-symfony-serializer - 2.7.9+dfsg-1
php-symfony-stopwatch - 2.7.9+dfsg-1
php-symfony-swiftmailer-bridge - 2.7.9+dfsg-1

php-symfony-translation - 2.7.9+dfsg-1
php-symfony-twig-bridge - 2.7.9+dfsg-1
php-symfony-twig-bundle - 2.7.9+dfsg-1

php-symfony-yaml - 2.7.9+dfsg-1
php5-symfony-debug - 2.7.9+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: symfony package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.7.9+dfsg-1').
